original_content:
QE Automation Architect
Qualification

Minimum Bachelor's degree or equivalent in computer engineering or a relevant field.
Minimum 13 years of experience in Automation.
Required Skill

Strong hands-on experience on Automation Frameworks, Design, Development, and Implementation.
Strong knowledge of Selenium / WebDriver, Cypress, API, TestNG or Junit.
Extensive experience in automating web service clients and providers for RESTful and SOAP implementation.
Hands-on experience in Selenium, Cypress, TestNG with Java, Appium Mobile Automation, Rest-Assured / SOAP UI / Karate Frameworks for API.
Expertise in Enterprise level Web, Mobile and Large-scale system Automation Architecture, and Implementation.
Desired experience in Mobile, Web and API automation.
Expert knowledge on Oracle / MySQL / RDBMS and SQL.
Knowledge of defect tracking and test management tools.
Strong knowledge on build/deployment automation and continuous integration is highly desirable.
Advanced understanding of source code repositories and branching and merging strategies.
Awareness to Software Development and Testing lifecycle.
Extensive experience in ROI calculations and stakeholder presentations.
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills.
Well versed with Internet technologies and infrastructure.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Responsibilities

Design test architectures (test automation frameworks, code libraries, etc.) for the team to use across the platforms.
Translate complex business needs into technical solutions.
Advise client on which set of Automation Tools would be best suited for the application landscape in terms of UI, API, Mobile, Data Services, DevOps pipeline, etc
Actively participate with sales executives in client meetings and help sell QA services. Working on Sales Support for RFPâ€™s.
Define strategic direction for testing by providing guidance, feedback, and suggestions to improve quality practices across an entire engineering team.
Evaluate multiple automation tools and develop Proof of Concepts (PoC) to ensure the suitability of the tool.
Perform integration of the automation solution with external tools & also with the CI/CD framework.
Drive non-functional testing like performance testing, security testing, accessibility testing etc. 
Drive shift left automation by adopting In-sprint automation, automate test cases at the API level and developing mocks to ensure continuity of tests.
Review code and process followed by team and provide feedback.
Work closely with clients, both in Business and Technical staff members.
Work in highly collaborative teams that strive to build quality code and provide business value.
Work with Automation and delivery team to ensure all deliverables are done according to plan and meets quality standards. Also helps to ensure that the processes are adhered to, suggest value additions & innovation.
Develop various utilities required to implement automation.
Help team overcome technical and non-technical challenges.
Mentor team members and help them grow next level.
